entry.title: 09-01-2017_Sheep Gap Fire Area, Rd, Tr Closure #075 (Sheep Gap Wildfire)
entry.summary: F17-075-LOLO-D5LOLO NATIONAL FOREST 24 Fort Missoula Road Missoula, Montana 59804-7297 FOREST SUPERVISOR’S ORDER Pursuant to Title 36 Code of Federal Regulations 261.50 (a & b), the following acts are prohibited as described below within the Plains/Thompson Falls Ranger District of the Lolo National Forest. These restrictions are in addition to those enumerated in Subpart A, Part 261, Title 36, Code of Federal Regulations, and become effective upon signing and will remain in effect until rescinded. 36 CFR – Special Closures It is prohibited to go into or be upon the area (36 CFR 261.53(e)). The closure cited in this order is to protect the public from potential harm from wildfires and firefighting operations associated with the Sheep Gap Fire. Description of Closed Areas: This area closure closes the area as described below and shown on the ATTACHED MAP. entry.title: Plains-Thompson Falls Community Meeting_Fire Situation_9-1-2017 (Sheep Gap Wildfire)
entry.summary: Community Meeting To discuss the current fire situation in the area of Thompson Falls and Plains 6 PM Friday, September 1, 2017 Thompson Falls Community Center 410 Golf Street, Thompson Falls Representatives from the Lolo and Kootenai National Forests, Sanders County Sheriff’s Department, Montana Disaster and Emergency Services, Sanders County Emergency Management, and the Department of Natural Resources and Conservation will be present to discuss the suppression effort, area and road closures, evacuation warnings and contingency

entry.title: 09-01-2017_Sheep Gap Fire Update (Sheep Gap Wildfire)
entry.summary: September 1, 2017, 7 A.M.Contact: John HamiltonPhone: 406-826-4345 or 406-529-5475 Inciweb: https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5558/ What: Sheep Gap and Deep Creek Fire Update Location: Sheep Gap fire is approximately 9 miles west of Plains, Plains-Thompson Falls Ranger District (T 20 North R 27 W Section 7); Deep Creek fire is approximately 12 miles northwest of Thompson Falls (T 23 North R 30 W Section 14) Size: Approximately 1,637 acres Containment: 0 Cause: Started by lightning August 29 The Sheep Gap and Deep Creek fires: Both fires were started by lightning earlier this week. A Type 3 organization was assigned management of the Deep Creek fire as well as the Sheep Gap fire as of this morning, September 1. The primary initial attack priorities on both fast-growing incidents is to first secure identified high-value resources while attempting to control these fires. entry.title: 08-31-2017_Sheep Gap Fire Update (Sheep Gap Wildfire)
entry.summary: August 31, 2017, 7 P.M. Contact: John Hamilton Phone: 406-826-4345 or 406-529-5475 Inciweb: https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5558/ What: Sheep Gap Fire Update Location: Fire is approximately 9 miles west of Plains, Plains-Thompson Falls Ranger District (T 20 North R 27 W Section 7) Size: Approximately 1000 acres Containment: 0 Cause: Started by lightning at approximately 5 p.m., Aug. 29 The Sheep Gap Fire: Fire was started by lightning on the evening of Aug. 29 and quickly grew to over 200 acres that night. By evening Aug 30, the fire has grown to an estimated 1000 acres. The Forest Service will conduct an infrared detection flight overnight to determine the new size and perimeter of the fire. Today firefighters reinforced fire line on the northern edge to prevent movement toward structures and other resources of value. Air tankers laid down a line of fire retardant along the south edge of Road 7581 to increase the road’s effectiveness as a fireline. Firefighters using...
